thread.title: Medibank inks multi-million dollar contract with Telstra
thread.title_full: Medibank inks multi-million dollar contract with Telstra | Business Spectator

author: Supratim Adhikari
title: Medibank inks multi-million dollar contract with Telstra
text:
Australia’s largest private health user, Medibank, has streamlined its roster of telecommunications service suppliers signing up Telstra as its sole service provider.
The three-year multi-million dollar contract will see Telstra service all of Medibank’s mobile, voice, data and service management needs. The insurer becomes the first customer of Telstra’s new Mobile Business Fleet Plus plans.
According to Medibank, whittling down its list of suppliers from eight to one will deliver annual savings of 37 per cent.
Medibank’s chief operating officer, David Koczkar, said the exclusive partnership with Telstra will also deliver business efficiencies and member benefits.
 “Our new, enhanced partnership with Telstra means we can streamline and consolidate our network into one provider, enhance our service levels through improved innovation and new technologies and continue to help our members along their health journey both in and out of hospital,” he said
As part of the deal, Telstra will refresh LAN and WAN equipment to mitigate network risks and improve capability, while delivering the latest in enterprise mobility services.
The total value of the deal was not disclosed.
